title: How to Change Snapchat Profile Picture: Gallery + Bitmoji

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This is your Bitmoji or Story icon at the top-left corner of your screen. A Public Profile is different from your normal Snapchat profile, which can only have a Bitmoji as a profile picture. A Public Profile gives you more access to tools to build a community. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Public Profile.
steps.content: Tap Public Profile . This is at the top of the page. If you don't see this, you don't have a Public Profile.

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon.
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon. This is at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap your current profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your current profile picture. This will be your avatar or current Bitmoji. Your Camera Roll or Gallery will open.

steps.title: Select a photo.
steps.content: Select a photo. Make sure the photo adheres to Snapchat's community guidelines.

steps.title: Tap Save Changes.
steps.content: Tap Save Changes . Your new profile picture will be set on your Public Profile. If you want to delete your current profile picture, tap the pencil icon again. Tap your profile picture, and then tap Delete Existing Photo .

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's your current profile picture located in the top-left corner. Your Bitmoji Selfie is the pose you see as your current profile picture. If you want to change how your Bitmoji looks first, see the next section to change the appearance .

steps.title: Tap your Bitmoji.
steps.content: Tap your Bitmoji. This is at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Change Selfie.
steps.content: Tap Change Selfie . This is the third option.

steps.title: Select a new selfie.
steps.content: Select a new selfie. Scroll down to find more options. A green checkmark will appear on it.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This will save your Bitmoji selfie.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's your current profile picture located in the top-left corner. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your Bitmoji.
steps.content: Tap your Bitmoji. This is at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Edit Avatar.
steps.content: Tap Edit Avatar . You may need to pull up the menu to find this option.

steps.title: Edit your Bitmoji.
steps.content: Edit your Bitmoji. Here, you can change your Bitmoji’s hair, accessories, makeup, facial features, and more. [3] X Research source If you want to change your outfit, return to the previous menu and select Change Outfit instead. You can also tap Pose & Background to change how this looks.

steps.title: Tap Save in the top-right.
steps.content: Tap Save in the top-right. This will confirm your changes and save your new Bitmoji appearance. Now the friends you’ve added on Snapchat will see and use your new Bitmoji look.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's your current profile picture located in the top-left corner. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings .
steps.content: Tap Settings . This gear-shaped icon is in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Bitmoji.
steps.content: Tap Bitmoji . It's under the My Account section.

steps.title: Tap Unlink My Bitmoji.
steps.content: Tap Unlink My Bitmoji . This text is at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Remove when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Remove when prompted. Doing this removes the Bitmoji avatar from your Snapchat profile. If you created your Bitmoji on Snapchat, this will permanently delete the Bitmoji. You can always create a new Bitmoji later.
